FacilityName: BASF CORPORATION CHATTANOOGA AMNICOLA HIGHWAY SITE

_accidents.OtherReleaseSource: 3/4" stainless steel tubing supplying lubrication oil to the compressor seal
_accidents.ED_Other: As a precautionery measure, approximately 1/4 mile of Amnicola Hwy. fronting the facility was isolated until the source & quantity of the release could be determined by BASF emergency responders.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY for: 

BASF Corporation 

32 Lost Mound Dr. (former address 3805 Amnicola Hwy.-city changed address) 

Chattanooga, Tn. 37406



Commitment to the Community



BASF Corporation has a long tradition of operating its facilities in the safest possible manner.  BASF also believes in being a responsible corporate citizen and maintaining open, constructive dialogue with our neighbors. These principles are an integral part of our corporate vision statement and values.  We believe that sharing this information with our neighbors makes good sense.  By doing so, we believe the community will better understand how safe and ecologically sound BASF operations are.





Policies



BASF Corporation has the following Corporate Guidelines related to environmental, health and safety:



We produce products that are safe to manufacture, use and dispose of.

We assist our customers to use our products safely and in an environmentally sound manner.  We provide them with information on correct handling of our products.

We minimize the impact on mankind and the environment during production, storage, transportation, marketing and use of our products.

Economic considerations do not take priority over environmental protection, health and safety.

An important contribution to "Sustainable Development" is our involvement in the "Responsible Care" initiative worldwide.  This applies to our products and services in all our businesses and affiliates.

We are committed to making continuous improvements in safety, health and environmental protection. We do this acting on our own initiative and in consultation with recognized regulatory authorities. We take any action judged to be necessary, whether or not dictated by statutory obligation or official regulations.

We encourage safety, environmental and health awareness among employees.

We regard it as an important corporate duty to advance science and technology in order to improve safety and environmenta

l protection.

We carefully weigh the potential benefits and risks of new discoveries and technologies in dialogue with scientists and society before deciding on how to proceed.

We pursue an open dialogue with all relevant opinion leaders in society.  Our goals are to promote and strengthen mutual understanding and deepen trust in what we do.



The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Amnicola Highway Site implements these policies through site-specific programs and procedures.



Facility Description



The BASF Corporation Chattanooga Amnicola Highway Site uses 1,3 Butadiene and Anhydrous Ammonia. Ammonia is used for cooling purposes only. 1,3 Butadiene is used to manufacture a water based emulsion polymer or dispersion. This dispersion is used in a variety of products including foams for pillows and mattresses, shoe inserts, general purpose adhesives and for asphalt modification to improve resiliency and extend the service life of streets and highways. 



Accidental Release Prevention Program



To prevent accidental releases, this facility is in compliance with the EPA Risk Management Program, the OSHA Process Safety Management standard, and the American Chemistry Council (ACC) Responsible Care Process Safety Code. 





Five Year Accident History



This facility experienced one accidental release(s) over the past five years, which meets the reporting criteria for internal property damage >$25K. The incident, occurring on 2/14/12 @ 0430 hours, was the result of a shaft coupling failure on an ammonia compressor. At the time of the failure, plant safeguards, including a water curtain & fixed fire water monitors were activated by plant personnel for vapor suppression/dispersion, local emergency responders (Chattanooga Fire Dept) were notified & responded. Together with trained BASF emergency responders, the incident was managed & successfully resolved without injury or damage to anyone inside or outside the facility. 





Emergency Response Program



This facility ha

s an emergency response plan that is coordinated with the community plan.  Facility HazMat team members are trained and participate in drills regularly. The BASF Chattanooga site is also the home of the Southeast Technical Resource and Chemical Emergency Response (TRACER)team which consists of Specialist Level Responders capable of responding to transportation incidents involving hazardous materials. These Specialist Responders have assisted local fire and emergency officials in managing non-BASF emergencies when called upon as well.  





Changes to Improve Safety



Facility processes are routinely changed to improve safety as a result of employee suggestions, process hazard analyses, incident investigations, etc.



For example, some changes already made that have improved the safety of our regulated processes include:



Installation of ammonia specific toxic sensors in all areas of the plant using ammonia. 

A vapor suppression system in the ammonia refrigeration unit has been constructed by totally surrounding the unit with an emergency deluge system providing a curtain of water for vapor knock down. 

A fixed deluge system has been installed directly over the ammonia pre-coolers in the finishing area for vapor suppression and knockdown.  

A fixed & dedicated emergency shortstop addition system has been added to the reactor area providing the capability of interupting any runaway polymerization event in any reactor. 



In addition to these changes already completed, the site is investigating the replacement of anhydrous ammonia with a safer alternate refrigerant.
